column1: Art Institute of Chicago////I'm not sure what my favorite work was
column2: it was either Van Gogh's 'Bedroom at Arles' or seeing 'A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte' by Georges Seurat (you know
column3: the painting where Cameron was metaphysically transformed from being mopey rich kid with daddy issues to full blown avant-guard/catatonic suicidal-ideations in the 80's classic mainstream blockbuster 'Ferris Buellers Day Off') or the Snow White and the Seven Dwarves Lock. Other favorites were Maximilien Luce 'La Saint-Chappelle' and Pierre Auguste Renoir 'Rowers Lunch'.
